originalevent.description:
Come and enjoy a wonderful day on the trails and relax on the lush lawns under the shade of the big trees at the charming Rosemary Hill farm.
 
The Rosemary Hill Trail Run will provide a great day out for trail runners & walkers on very well marked and beautifully maintained trails. The trails are mostly custom-made single-track with occasional jeep track and meander through our working farm with bits of forest, farm dams, water streams and even some old ruins to explore.
 
After the race, breakfast can be enjoyed at the lovely Rosemary Hill restaurant and tea garden situated in the lush gardens next to the start/finish line. With a mouth watering all day menu and a designer tea and coffee menu, tired and hungry runners can refuel with food freshly prepared and served with freshly picked herbs and vegetables from the farm's organic garden. As a family friendly venue, there are lots of entertainment for the kids so bring the whole family and spend a active, fun-filled day away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Venue:
Rosemary Hill Farm, Pretoria East
www.rosemaryhill.co.za
 
Race options and costs:
6km Basil Run - R80
10km Lavender Run - R100
21km Rosemary Run - R150

05h30 - 07h15
 
Race start times:

10km - 07h45
6km - 08h00
 
Timekeeping:
Timekeeping will be done by Racetime (www.racetime.co.za)
 
Photographers:
There will be official event photographers on the route.
 
Route Description:
Easy running on well manicured single track and short sections of jeep track.
 
Water Points:
6km – no water point
10km – 1 water point
21km – 2 water points
 
Prizes and Medals:
Medals to first 800 finishers
Prize money (to both male and female overall winners):
1st overall 21km – R500

3rd overall 21km – R15

Full direction on the Rosemary Hill Website

originalevent.description:
החלטתי שיהיה יותר כיף ומשמעותי לצאת לטיול שחרור במקום לקיים שתיית שחרור.

התוכנית היא לצאת ביום חמישי מוקדם יחסית (סביבות 14) לחניון הלילה יהודייה שברמת הגולן. 

בערב מתוכנן פויקה צמחוני עם תוספות כמו חצילים ופלפלים על האש, כל מיני תוספות, בירות, יין, גיטרות, מוזיקה וחברים.

בבוקר נצא ישר מהחניון למסלול המעגלי של נחל יהודיה (כ 3 שעות הליכה), שכולל סולמות, בריכות ונוקודת חן נוספות.

http://cms.education.gov.il/EducationCMS/Units/Tiyulim/maslulim/RamatHgolan/RamatHgolan1/ms146.htm

המחירים הם 16 שקלים לחניון לילה (אין בו מקלחות) ו22 שקלים לכניסה למסלול.

חוץ מזה אני רוצה שנאסוף כסף לאוכל ולהוצאות נוספות של הטיול במקום למתנת שחרור.

ברור שיהיה נחמד אם אנשים יביאו גם בני זוג אם בא להם.

זהו בינתיים. נתעדכן פה.
אני מתרגש נורא ומקווה שיבואו כמה שיותר אנשים.
originalevent.name: טיול שחרור למוסקו

originalevent.description:
HEADLINER : Frivolous  < Cadenza / Scape : Canada >

Online tickets now sold out!

Hello friends,

It's that time again; to get excited for long sunny days on the Olifant's River, bobbing to a laidback soundtrack of the finest electronic music makers in the land! Shake the dust off your floatila devices and meet us where the lush grass meets the crystal waters; where the moon shines over the mountain and adventure seekers come together to dance, play and howl from their hearts.

Due to popular demand, and what we'd like to call just wonderful common sense, really; the event takes place over four days this time, from 21st - 25th January 2016. That’s Thursday to Monday, 4 days of back-to-nature camping and 2 days of music festival frolics in premium mid-Summer Citrusdal heat. So we suggest, if at all possible, start your new year… by taking a few days off! We invite you to immerse yourself in Lilo River Flow 2016.

The music line-up is epic, and there is another surprise in store that promises to leave a lasting impression, much like in the vein of Daedelus earlier this year. Please keep your eyes super-tuned into Facebook and Twitter for updates and important info, all the goodness will be revealed in November.


LINE-UP

FRIDAY

♫ Ian Skene
♫ Chris Jack
♫ Dave Ireton
♫ Matt Blitz
♫ Ivan Turanjanin
♫ Kanan K7
♫ Digital Rockit (Official)

SATURDAY

♫ Dan C
♫ Tommy Gun
♫ Andy Islands [LIVE]
♫ Original Swimming Party [LIVE]
♫ LEEU [LIVE]
♫ Terrence Pearce
♫ Frivolous (Canada) [LIVE]
♫ Lady M
♫ Helmut J & Ryan Sullivan
♫ Bruno Morphet

SUNDAY

♫ Robin Would & Kyle Russouw
♫ Charles Large
♫ Richard Marshall


FRIVOLOUS

Frivolous is the imaginary personification of Daniel Gardner's obsession with sound-design for both dancing and living alike. Manifesting in a multitude of performances and recorded works, his sound has been described as jazz-infused minimal or experimental house. His live shows have been hailed for their energy, originality and ingenuity. Never compromising the art of showman-ship, these spectacles feature live keyboards and vocals as well as the incorporation of his DIY aesthetic. Integrating homemade devices such as the "Frivolous Patented Electromagnetic knife", the "Broken-Ruler Music Box" and the Double "Cable-Tub" Bass, his sets are injected with a sense of fantasy, imagination and personality scarcely found elsewhere in modern electronic dance music.

http://www.residentadvisor.net/dj/frivolous 
https://soundcloud.com/frivolous 


CAMPING

BYO Camping

These tickets are a full weekend pass and give you access to the festival and the riverbank for all four nights. Camping is down stream from the festival site and is in one of the most beautiful glades on the Olifants River. Your own camping gear is mandatory but you will still be furnished with hot water and flushing toilets. A very comfortable place to camp, we guarantee! Please Note: Cars are not permitted to park in the camping area, a nearby field serves as the parking lot, a very short stroll away from the campsite.

LUX Camping

This includes a festival pass, four nights on the river bank and camping upstream from the festival site. Here is where you can leave your tents, mattresses, sleeping bags and pillows at home. On arrival you will be ushered to a two man tent that is part of a three tent village (i.e. six people per village). Lux camping comes with tents, mattresses and bedding, camping chairs, a table, hot plate, braai, kettle, toaster, cultery and crockery - all under a bedouin tent, so you're covered in shade, with access to electricity all weekend. We highly recommend getting a crew of six together and making a village of friends to spend the weekend together glamping it up in style! Price is per person sharing.

 
LONGER RELAXATION

As always our manifesto behind the Weekender is to invite you not only to a music festival, but to a weekend away, and in the spirit of this we are changing the format of the whole experience slightly to encourage ever deeper relaxation and engagement with our exquisite valley. This time around guests are invited to arrive as early as Thursday 21 January, set up camp, get comfortable and really get on holiday.

There is plenty to do in and around the festival site including swimming, fishing, canoeing, hiking, day-dreaming, star-gazing, bird-watching and braaing. On Friday afternoon the music gently fires up for the weekend, coming to an end on Sunday afternoon. As always we will be having a lunch time spit braai on Sunday and our usual Sunday night sleepover - and everyone is welcome to stay on. The festival site closes to our guests at lunch time on Monday 25 January, so please stay over and see out the weekend with us.


We cannot wait to host you down by the river again!

Much love from the Citrus Valley
The Wolfkop Team

http://www.wolfkopweekender.co.za
originalevent.name: Wolfkop Weekender : Lilo River Flow 2016

originalevent.description:
This summer, 19 December 2015, we return to the spiritual home of Love and Light – The Mountain Shadows in Paarl. Featuring a line up of the absolute finest in international and local progressive psy-trance DJ’s, including Captain Hook, Liquid Soul and Ritmo, this installment of Love & Light promises to be the best one yet.

The party kicks off at midday on Saturday but arrive early to take in the mountain views, go for a swim in the crystal clear dam or grab a drink or bite to eat from our fully licensed bars or one of the gourmet food stalls. You can also explore our hippie market, with the latest trend in Bohemian fashion and accessories. The party ends at 11:45pm, giving you 12 hours of mind-blowing electronic music at one of the most breathtaking venues in The Cape.


                            **FEATURED ARTISTS**

LIQUID SOUL

Nicola Capobianco, better known as LIQUID SOUL is undoubtedly one of the biggest names in the Psy-Progressive world today, playing next to artists like Tiesto and Armin van Buuren. After countless hypnotic releases on top labels, and playing worldwide for over a decade, he won the Beatport award for the Best Psy-Trance Track in 2009. In 2010 he achieved his greatest success by winning the prizes for Best Beatport Artist and Best Beatport Track at the DJ Awards in Ibiza in the Psy-Trance categories.

LINKS:
http://www.soundcloud.com/liquid-soul
http://www.youtube.com/user/liquidsouliboga
http://www.liquidsoul.ch
http://www.facebook.com/sleekmusic
http://www.facebook.com/earsugar

CAPTAIN HOOK

CAPTAIN HOOK has become a household name amongst all lovers of quality Progressive-Psy music - a project that has travelled to the furthest corners of the globe, memorizing dance floors. He is known for delivering exhilarating and dynamic sets with the phattest, punchiest bass lines and electrifying rhythms that instantly have you hooked.

Social Links:
https://www.facebook.com/ReshefHook
https://soundcloud.com/captain-hook

RITMO

RITMO has deservedly become one of the busiest artists within the Progressive-Psy genre. He has managed to formulate a unique technique that captures moments in our lives and translates them into an addictive rhythmic creation that’s been rocking dance floors around the globe. His unique and energetic sound signature continues to add a fresh imprint on the ever-growing Psy-Trance scene globally.

Social links:
https://www.facebook.com/ritmomusic
https://soundcloud.com/ritmomusic


                                          **VENUE**

Our spectacular venue is Mountain Shadows, off Keerweder Road in Paarl (7620), no more than 63km's from Cape Town - the directions (below) are so simple that you will not need your GPS.
Gates open at 11am on Saturday morning
Mountain Shadows:www.mountainshadows.co.za
GPS CO-ORDINATES ARE: S 33 . 74. . 089 E 019 . 04 . 455

DIRECTIONS:
From Cape TownTake Exit 62 off the N1 Highway.(Sonstraal Road). Turn left off the exit. At the second stop (see BP garage on your left), turn right here and follow this road (Keerweder Rd) (2Km) (pass Rosendal on the left and Beaumont Stud (on the right) until you see our sign on your right. Take the dirt road to the entrance and Mountain Shadows Guest House

From Cape Town International AirportLeave the airport via the N2 Highway, towards Somerset West (not Cape Town!). Nestled between the Picturesque Camps Bay Beach and the striking Clifton 4th beach lies an oasis of lush green grass, white beach sand and translucent blue waters known as Maidens Cove. 

On Saturday 12 December we transform this magnificent place into a magical feast for the senses in a day of sunshine, merriment, music, food and dance as we celebrate all that is Cape Town and all that is Summer.

A seamless blend of musical majesty will be brought to you by an array of local artists including 

NEELIX (Germany) Supported by:

Strange Loving
Chris De Vos 
Dane Stirrat
Yeti
Ian Skene
Kyle Maclean
Headroom
Deliriant
Josh Horwitz
Dewdrop

So diarise the 12th of the 12th for 12 hours of fun in the sun.

We've got you covered with a selection of food stalls, ATMs on site / fully stocked bars / chill tents - bring your sunscreen / lilos / boardshorts / bikinis and smiles!

NEELIX : 
https://www.facebook.com/neelixmusic/

There's only one obvious thing in the sound of Neelix: Relentless forward boost. Exactly how this boost is generated is not obvious at all – which makes it catchy in the most subliminal way possible. The German artist playfully incorporates elements of Progressive Trance, Progressive House and Electro. However, the actual magic of Neelix happens somewhere inbetween those genres. For 10 years already this unique formula made him a crowd-pleaser at a great variety of dance events on all 5 continents, including monumental festivals like Electric Daisy Carnival, Tomorrowland or Boom.

Ticket Information :

Regular Tickets  : R260

DISCLAIMER:

The organizers do not assume any responsibility for loss or damage to any property brought onto the premises nor for any loss of life or damage to persons. No Alcohol and NO Illegal substances allowed. No under 20's. R.O.A.R

originalevent.description:
Wolkfop Weekender : Power Flower Picnic brings you Daedelus & Felix Laband LIVE.

It feels like just a few weeks ago we were thanking everyone for making Lilo River Flow such an amazing experience in January, and here we are already, rolling out details for the next Power Flower Picnic! We're excited to announce three days of music, kicking off with a full compliment of artists on Friday night. 

Power Flower Picnic will take place on the river bank of the Olifant's Rivier, and while it might be a bit chilly to dip into the river this time around, she will be rushing full and fast past our celebration on the dancefloor. We can't wait to host you once again, and welcome the warmer weather with our annual salute to the new season in the Citrusdal Valley.

WEEKENDER LINE-UP

❀ Daedelus LIVE
❀ Felix Laband LIVE
-----------------------
❀ Ashton
❀ Dino Moran 
❀ Black Book 
❀ Bteam
------------------------
❀ Rebel Clef
❀ Spekta
❀ Valve State 
❀ Dank
❀ Card on Spokes
❀ dj low
❀ Cabin Crew
❀ Bruno Morphet
-----------------------
❀ Helmut J & Ryan Sullivan
❀ Private Life


DAEDELUS
Alfred Darlington, a native of Los Angeles, California, makes his African debut with us at Wolfkop Weekender, and we couldn’t be more delighted. A longstanding member of the Dublab, it wasn’t long before his leftfield, off pitch sounds were being taken note of by record labels as prominent as Ninja Tune and Warp. He stands out in electronic music for his innate ability to fuse organic instruments like bass, piano, accordion and guitar (all played by himself) into intricate electronica that is as beautiful as it is brash, melodious as it is melancholic. With well over ten studio albums under his belt and association with labels as esteemed as Brainfeeder, Alpha Pup and Stones Throw, this truly marks the arrival of one of the godfathers of intelligent dance music. A pioneer and master of the Monome, seeing Daedelus live is something that people don’t easily forget, seeing him on a river bank will make memories that will last a lifetime. Daedelus plays Saturday at 7pm.

FELIX LABAND
There are few words left to write about Felix, especially in the South African sense. He seems to have been indiscreetly scrutinised by almost everyone who has any interest in electronic music, and for good reason. His fourth album ‘Deaf Safari’ - released earlier this year on Compost Records - embalms his reputation as one of the world’s great sample addicts. He stands as a master of re-imagination, almost every nuance of Felix’s music is another idea, mauled and manipulated until they meander through his sonic soundscapes like ghosts in the haunted houses of folklore. Impractical to pigeon-hole and impossible to predict, we choose to do none of these things and simply invite you to see him live with us, if you were at the last Power Flower Picnic you’ll know he has a knack for the space. Felix plays on Saturday at 6pm.

Tickets Available from Quicket:
https://www.quicket.co.za/events/10299-wolfkop-weekender-power-flower-picnic-2015/#/

TICKETING OPTIONS

BYO (BRING YOUR OWN) CAMPING [R450]
These tickets are a full weekend pass and give you access to the festival and the riverbank for all three nights. Camping is down stream from the festival site and is in one of the most beautiful glades on the Olifants River. Your own camping gear is mandatory but you will still be furnished with hot water and flushing toilets. A very comfortable place to camp, we guarantee!

LUXURY CAMPING (limited) [R950]
This includes a festival pass, three nights on the river bank and camping upstream from the festival site. Here is where you can leave your tents, mattresses, sleeping bags and pillows at home. On arrival you will be ushered to a two man tent that is part of a three tent village (i.e. six people per village). Access to electricity all weekend at your village is included as is a toaster, hot plate and kettle as well as hot water and flushing toilets. We highly recommend getting a crew of six together and making a village of friends to spend the weekend together glamping it up in style! Price is per person sharing.

All event information and directions can be found at the Wolfkop Weekender Website.

LINKS
Website: http://www.wolfkopweekender.co.za 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/WolfkopWeekend 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wolfkopweekender 
Tickets: https://www.quicket.co.za/events/10299-wolfkop-weekender-power-flower-picnic-2015/#/

Join us as we welcome the warmer weather with a dance in the wild flowers.

originalevent.description:
NOTE – The Franschhoek Mountains in July can be covered in snow. The rivers are scenic yet cold. These runs are a wilderness adventure, for which you need to be prepared – you have been warned!

Online Entries Close: Tuesday 7 July 2015 9am!!! Late entries can be done at registration.

This festival of adventure trail running sold out last year, numbers are limited. You are assured of a wild time, wet feet and rewarding OBS, served by French Maids and Men at the end. The Bastille Festival in the Main Street is a vibrant mix of good food and wine, to celebrate with, after your run. If staying over (highly recommended), book accommodation now – chat to Franschhoek Tourism ASAP

50km - 06:30
35km - 07:00
25km - from 08:00 (10min Batch Starts)
15km - from 09:00 (10min Batch Starts)

Venue open from 6:00am on race day!

The start finish zone is located at the ‘Old Bells Lodge’ on the edge of the Berg River dam, (33’56’12.83’S, 19′ 4’27.14’E). Coming from Paarl side, head through Franschhoek on the main road (R45) until you hit the T-Junction at the Franschhoek Monument. Turn right and then right again onto the Robertsvlei road. Carry on for 5km and marshals will direct you to the parking.
Route info:

15km (R225): Not such a beginner trail run, mostly on forest tracks and gravel roads, with some single-track and short technical (loose rocks, bushy) section. Moderate inclines. Your feet will get wet at river crossings. All rocks are slippery!

25km (R325): Not for beginners. Open gravel road start with a hill to spread the field, takes you to a vertical firebreak climb, and on to a gnarly and exposed single track – with amazing views. This is a ‘no passing’ zone, as a tumble will go on for a while. Over the neck and on to forest tracks and wooded river-side single-track. That’s halfway! This is not a sprint, but an adventure. Compulsory kit.

35km (R425): For the hard-core mountain goats. Follows the same route as the 24km, then veers off to circumnavigate the Berg river dam.

50km (R525): Two extra mountain summits and two beautiful valleys. Take lots of food (expected time 5-8 hours)
Compulsory Equipment for all:

Compulsory Equipment for 25km, 35km, 50km categories.

1) Rain Jacket (waterproof, not just wind breaker, which you may have as well);
2) Sensible Clothing for the conditions, eg. compulsory thermal base layer;
3) Charged cell phone in waterproof bag eg. Ziplock (organizers - for emergencies only - 072 924 2371);
4) Food – sarmie, fruit, energy bars - for 4 to 10 hours!
5) Water – hydration pack, with bladder. You will be crossing several fresh water rivers.
6) Space Blanket & Whistle
7) Headlamp/Torch and Race Map - provided

Compulsory Equipment for 15km

1) Rain Jacket (waterproof, not just wind breaker, which you may have as well);
2) Sensible Clothing for the conditions;
3) Water – hydration pack, with bladder. You will be crossing several fresh water rivers.

Recommended Equipment:
Beanie, Buff, Gloves. Ladies, add a couple of layers. Toes, fingers freeze. Lips go blue.

Trail Gear available in Salomon Concept Store. Sale starts 7th July
originalevent.name: Salomon Bastille Day Trail Run

originalevent.description:
"The inaugural Matroosberg Trail Challenge was a refreshing reminder of why trail running is such a great sport. A low key race without much hype - just a few tough nutters running up and down a mountain in freezing weather. The route was amazing and although we couldn’t tag the summit due to the weather there were few complaints. Climbing straight up the mountain off the starting line was breathtaking in more ways than one! Taking in the views of the snow covered peaks when they appeared briefly between the clouds was spectacular. Descending in crunchy snow was a new experience for most of us and added some extra spice to the fast technical drop back towards warm food and a well deserved cuppa.
The race was well organized with simple registration process, good communication and fantastic prizes. Well done to Ghaleed and his team for creating a truly memorable experience. I will be back for more for sure."

~ Michael Owen - 2012 Winner and King of the Mountain

originalevent.description:
Oh where to begin, and how to tell the tale of Balkanology? Years of debauchery and perverse story telling through theatre, music, dance and drink. Parties themed by stories taken from the depths of greek mythology and some borrowed from Christ himself. 

In 2012 Balkanology was put to rest.

Until now. 

What to expect? Ha! Nothing short of an NDE. A Near Death Experience. Feelings of levitation, total serenity, security, warmth, the experience of absolute dissolution, walking through a tunnel of light. Then, flashing before your eyes, a recap, if you will, of 8 years of celebrations. 

Dress code: Black Tie

For any questions please refer to the Q & A below before contacting us.

Will there be farm animals? Yes.
Will the be flying ones, like maybe pigs or siamese rodents? Yes.
And a funeral, will there be one of those? Yes
A wedding? Yes. 
What about a resurrection? Of course.
War? Yes. 
Peace? Yes. 
Magicians and wizards? Umm…. yes. 
Maoriginal? Yes!
Toby2shoes? Yessssssss!
What about the Kolo Novo Movie Band? A tribute to the president of the Kolo Novo republic... the great Grada Djeri? Yes.
Time for a reunion? Yeah, we reckon. 
And and and what about... 
Hush now… enough.

Join us for pre drinks at the Romanian Peasant Museum.
Address: Șoseaua Pavel Dimitrievici Kiseleff 3, Bucharest, Romania. Open bar.

Balkanology will be held at Sideshow (old Vaudeville/Fez)

originalevent.description:
ALL INFO POWER FLOWER PICNIC

Wolfkop Weekender returns to the Citrusdal Valley for it’s 2nd installment for 2014. Power Flower Picnic takes us away from the river and into the lush pastures for a weekend of deep beats of a different kind. Following on from the unique atmosphere created at January’s Lilo River Pub Flow; live electronica, daytime dubs and other moody music will be purveyed around a crystal clear dam, in a field of wild flowers.


LINE-UP:

SATURDAY

10:00 – Ghost Track 
10:30 – Dan C
12:00 – Bruno Morphet
13:30 – Valve State
15:00 – Card on Spokes
16:30 – Felix Laband
18:00 – System off
----------------------------------------
19:00 – Black Book
21:00 – Kanan K7 & Richard Marshall
23:00 – Bruno Morphet
----------------------------------------

SUNDAY

10:00 – Richard Marshall
11:00 – Black Book
12:00 – Private Life
17:00 – System off


TICKETS:

- Tickets are limited to 400 for the weekend and will be sold on a first come first serve basis.

- Full weekend pass with equipped tented camp: R700 includes a set-up campsite with electricity, bedding, mattresses, cooking gear, braai and ablutions with hot water.

- Full weekend pass with camping spot: R350 excludes a set-up camp, includes a demarcated camping space [bring your own gear] and ablutions with hot water.

- Purchase your tickets here: https://www.quicket.co.za/events/5857-wolfkop-weekender-power-flower-picnic/ 

HOW IT WORKS:

Friday: Gates open at 3:00pm. Arrive at campsite and enjoy relaxed time out with your friends around a fire. A communal braai area will be available for those wishing to turn a chop. The soundsystems will be silent tonight.

Saturday: Event starts at 10:00am at a specially selected area that is covered in flowers and moves to the campsite stage after sunset +- 7:00pm. The music stops at 2:00am.

Sunday: Music starts at the campsite at 10:00am and goes on until 5pm. We encourage you to stay for a full day of beats, lunch will be available from selected vendors. Those who can are welcome to stay over on Sunday night, at no extra cost.

GOOD TO KNOW:

- A fully-stocked bar will be available in the flowers and at the main river-side campsite.
- Food truck vendors and stalls will be available on site throughout the festival.
- Lara Roux will host a guided yoga class at 9am on Saturday & Sunday morning by the river
- Freshly-squeezed, free orange juice will be available for everyone, all weekend. Feel tree to taint with your favourite tipple.
- The water in the valley is drinkable and delicious so leave bottled water on the shelves, where it belongs.
- We’re having a picnic, so don't forget blankets, lunch baskets and all that comes with it.
- Bring your wellies and an umbrella, in case there’s a spot of mud or rain.
- Don’t forget! A headlamp or torch for night-vision afterdark.

IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENTS:

Weather: Temperatures can go up to 28 degrees during the day, however, it will still be extremely chilly in these hills at night so prepare to dress warmly for evenings. We suggest you bring layers of clothes and a warm jacket and beanie for the evenings. ;-)

Postponement: We are at the mercy of the weather gods. If the weather is terrible the EVENT WILL BE MOVED TO 5/6/7 SEPTEMBER. In the event the festival is postponed until the following weekend, full refunds (ex. 10% Quicket fee) will be given to those who can no longer attend.

LINKS:

Tickets: http://www.quicket.co.za/events/5857-wolfkop-weekender-power-flower-picnic/ 
Website Link: http://www.wolfkopweekender.co.za 
Facebook Page Link: https://www.facebook.com/wolfkopweekender 
Facebook Event Link: https://www.facebook.com/events/606541179460416/ 

ABOUT WOLFKOP

Wolfkop Nature Reserve is nestled in the Olifants River Valley in Citrusdal and takes it’s name from the nickname the first local farmers gave the shapely mountain that backs the riverbank of the reserve. While the only thing you’ll find howling at the moon are happy campers, the land is abundant with wildlife and it’s not uncommon to hear a troop of baboons echoing through the range.

The reserve has a variety of accommodation options available, including remote cottages, wood cabins, and tent and caravan villages, perfect for travellers passing through slowly and families and groups of friends alike, looking for a quick getaway or weekend retreat. The venue never sways from reminding your free spirit, that this is a great outdoor destination. 

The heart of Wolfkop’s offering is a quest to provide a truly off-grid experience, to allow one to reconnect with themselves and nature. To appreciate the sweet sounds, fresh earthly aromas, blue skies, soft breezes, crystal clear water, and rolling, lush green fields; all in a moment that is not connected to time or destiny. 

Free-spirited travellers, this is your next stop.
originalevent.name: Wolfkop Weekender Power Flower Picnic

originalevent.description:
PLEASE TAKE NOTE THAT THIS EVENT IS EXCLUSIVE TO THE FIRST 500 PRE-SALE TICKETS ONLY – STRICTLY NO CARS ALLOWED / SHUTTLE BUSES ONLY 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Well are we excited to present this event to you !! 
We really have saved the BEST FOR LAST ! This is the HOLY GRAIL of all Make-Believe venues to date (lush grass lawn, trees with plenty of shade, clean river to swim and bar on the water), and to make it that much more special we are featuring the artist we believe has that perfect fit between deep house and dirty tech grooves – SIOPIS (Berlin). 
Initially as Silversurfer his signature sound of raw, dark bass-lines & crazy hooks with attitude were first noticed by Damian Lazarus and signed to Crosstown Rebels, Get Physical, Rebellion & more ... Living in the jungle he connected deeply with nature and himself and an awakening new creative energy led him to the decision to start a new project ~ SIOPIS. 
Quick transitions, sublime mixing skills and an edgier sound is what makes this man truly represent Make-Believe.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

In true Make-Believe style we are offering our first 30 guests a FULL WEEKEND GETAWAY at the stunning MOFAM RIVER LODGE - to spend with Siopis and the Make-Believe crew. Flanking the dance-floor are 11 x two-sleeper chalets, & 2 x four-sleeper, uber-comfortable, wooden chalets on stilts which will be your accommodation for the weekend (Fri morning - Sunday afternoon). The full weekend pass includes a full spread breakfast on Sat & Sunday morning (09h00-11h00) and the opportunity to take advantage of Mofam's aqueous activities (kayaking/wake-boarding/fishing/barge-riding or swimming), hiking, quad-biking or just plain lazing about on the grass, or at the bar on the water. There really is nothing quite like the tranquility at Mofam. Stay the weekend and relax with Siopis & Co.

Call 0822920744 to book your chalet ASAP.

And for another 500 bass-hungry, drooly-eyed music-lovers:

SATURDAY 12 APRIL ~ SHUTTLE BUSES

originalevent.description:
It is the season to be jolly and whatnot, so this last After Hours for the year will be a suitable celebration.

World-renowned composer Richard Pantcheff (yes, Google him) has kindly volunteered to play everyone's favourite Christmas carols on the upright piano for what could well work out to be a massive sing-along. No musical skills are required from those attending, other than a festive mood.

Lindsy Bacon and friends will set up their own bar and will be mixing up some cheeky cocktails.

Chef Tom Couper has put together a nice little menu with all the holiday-season favourites, so no one has to celebrate without a mince pie.

Ah, and for the wine lovers, the Zevenwacht wines made especially for Rand Club will go at half price.

All of this for R50 at the door, so please put on your finery and let the vocal cords loose.

For those who have not been to Rand Club before, the directions to the venue and the dress codes are on the club website www.randclub.co.za

I will be sending the guest list to the club at 12h00 on the date, so please remember to confirm attendance before then; friends and significant others are welcome.
originalevent.name: Christmas Carols After Hours

originalevent.description:
NewClr (pronounced new clear/nuclear) is an independent gallery and studio situated at 70 Juta Street, Braamfontein.

We are a space which opened as a part of the resurgence and desire to take back the city, drench it in colour and leave our mark on her face. There’s an electric excitement in the city right now, whether it be fashion, art or general expression...This city is ours and it’s our responsibility to build up the city that built us.

The artwork being exhibited is an eclectic mix, including: Limited digital prints, photography, illustration, graf + stencil art, custom canvas cushions, beaded action figures and t-shirts.

Everything on sale on the day.

www.newclr.com

originalevent.description:
(***) חברות וחברים,

500 הכרטיסים החינמיים שלנו נחטפו תוך פחות מ-12 שעות, וההרשמה נסגרה! 

שלחנו מיילי אישור לכלל הנרשמים - אנא בידקו אם קיבלתם את המייל. לשאלות ובעיות - פנו אלינו בעמוד בהודעה פרטית (Wize).

כל מי ששילם על כרטיס - מוזמן לבדוק את ולידיות ההזמנה שלו ישירות מול קרן מסושיאליז (keren@socialbusiness.co.il) - הכרטיסים בתשלום *אינם* דרך Wize.

נתראה בפעם הבאה!

תודה רבה,
צוות Wize (***)

פרויקט Wize שמח להזמין אתכם לערב מיוחד עם פרופסור דן אריאלי בשיתוף עם Socialize14!

אנחנו גאים לארח את פרופסור דן אריאלי בפעם השנייה בפרויקט,  אריאלי הוא פרופסור לכלכלה התנהגותית הנחשב לאחד המומחים המובילים בעולם.

להזמנת מקומות ופרטים נוספים, לחצו See More 

**
האירוע בתשלום אך לחברי WIZE יש קוד מיוחד  המקנה כניסה בחינם- כרגיל האירועים שלנו הם ללא תשלום. 

**
ההרשמה לאירוע Irrational evening with Prof. Dan Ariely
מתבצעת בקישור הבא:
http://socialize14.evolero.com/registration/start

הקוד לאירועי הוא WizeNight

פרופ' אריאלי ידבר על behavior by design - שנוי התנהגות באמצעות עיצוב הסביבה, אפליקציה או אפילו טופס.

אריאלי כיהן כפרופסור לכלכלה התנהגותית בבית הספר לניהול ע"ש סלואן ב-MIT. כיום מכהן כפרופסור לכלכלה התנהגותית בקתדרה על-שם ג'יימס בי. דיוק (James B. Duke Professor of Behavioral Economics) בבית הספר לעסקים על שם פיוקווא, וכעמית מחקר בכיר במכון קנאן לאתיקה (Kenan Institute for Ethics). אף שאין לו רקע אקדמי בכלכלה, הוא נחשב לאחד ממובילי תחום הכלכלה ההתנהגותית.

האירוע יהיה בשיתוף פעולה עם socialize14.

האירוע יתקיים ביום רביעי  ה-11.06, בבר "פאפאיתו", רחוב שלמה 29, תל אביב יפו

19:00 פתיחת שערים, 20:00- דן אריאלי על הבר!
צוות Wize ו- Socialize

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WIZE היא עמותה ללא מטרות רווח שהוקמה על ידי צעירים תל-אביביים במטרה להוביל לשינוי תרבות הצעירים בישראל. הקבוצה מפיקה אירועים הכוללים אנשים איכותיים, הרצאה בת-שעה והרבה אלכוהול

האירועים עוסקים בנושאים מגוונים - ממדע פופולרי, דרך היי-טק ויזמות וכלה בתרבות. במהלך תקופה קצרה של עשייה יצרה הקבוצה "טרנד" שהתפשט גם לבאר שבע, ראשון לציון, הקריות, ניר-עם וירושלים - אליו מצטרפים מדי שבוע מאות אנשים חדשים, ויוצרים יחד תרבות חדשה של צעירים
originalevent.name: וואו, זה נראה מעניין! דן אריאלי על שינוי התנהגות באמצעות עיצוב הסביבה ובירה

originalevent.description:
הרבה מנוף האיומים סביבנו קשור לסייבר. איומי סייבר, ביטחון סייבר, מלחמת סייבר, מודיעין סייבר, ריגול סייבר ועוד. סייבר היא מילה נרדפת לאינטרנט, אבל לפעמים לא הכל קשור לאינטרנט. ריכוז המאמצים בהגנות בחזית האינטרנט מביא לעיתים להנחות מוטעות ולהתעלמות מאיומים הרבה יותר פשוטים אך לא פחות מסוכנים. ההרצאה תדגים לנו את הפשטות והסיכון בכיוון זה.

ענבר רז מנהל את המחלקה למחקר תוכנות זדוניות (Malware) ואבטחת מידע בצ'ק פוינט.
הוא מרצה ומלמד על אבטחה באינטרנט ו-Reverse Engineering כמעט מאז שהחל להתעסק בנושא בעצמו. הוא החל לתכנת כשהיה בן 9, בגיל 13 קיבל את המחשב האישי הראשון שלו ומיד החל בלנסות להבין איך עובד המחשב. מגיל 14 ודרך התיכון הוא היה דמות מפתח בסצנת הבי.בי.אסים (BBS) הישראלית. את רוב הקריירה שלו העביר בתחום של אבטחת אינטרנט והסיבה היחידה שהוא לא יושב בכלא עכשיו היא שהוא בחר בצד הנכון של החוק כבר בגיל צעיר. ענבר מתמחה בגישת מחשבה מחוץ לקופסה לאנליזה של אבטחה ואיתור נקודות תורפה (Vulnerabilities) תוך שימוש בניסיונו הרחב שצבר במעל ל-20 שנים בתחום. כמו כן, הרצה במספר כנסים בינלאומיים, ביניהם: Kaspersky SAS, Hack.lu, ZeroNights, ShowMeCon וקונגרס e-crime. 

האירוע יתקיים בדיזי פרישדון, דיזנגוף 121 תל אביב.
להזמנת מקומות נא להתקשר לטלפון: 03-5234111.

פתיחת שערים ב-19:00, ההרצאה תחל ב-20:00.

כמו בכל ההרצאות שלנו, הכניסה חינם.

נתראה על הבר,
צוות וייז תל אביב

originalevent.description:
Hey, campers!

Once again, TEDxUCT is hosting a Treasure Hunt to bend your brains and exercise your booties!

Join us for a trip around your campus and the surrounding areas - follow the clues you are given in an "Amazing Race Style" game and try and beat all the other teams to the finish line in this event which symbolises one of TEDxUCT's goals - uniting and connecting members from the UCT community and providing a platform for them to learn and grow! 

Prizes?

The winning team will get tickets to our next TEDxUCT conference to be held later in the year, but there will be a bunch of other goodies to keep you happy until then. 

Cost?

R30 a ticket secures your spot as well as gets you a bunch of snacks along the way and some food to chomp at the finish line! payment can be made in cash on the day.

To enter:

write the name and surnames of each of your 5 team members on the wall or email us at tedxuct@gmail.com. give us your team name and at least one person's contact details. If you don't have a full team or are coming solo, give us your name and we'll find you one :)

each team needs a car and a smart phone, but if you don't have then don't stress - let us know and we'll arrange it for you!

Meet on the day at 3pm in Molly Blackburn Hall and prepare for an adventure that you won't soon forget!
originalevent.name: TEDxUCT Treasure Hunt 2014

originalevent.description:
Hello Ladies and Gentlemen

As you should know by now this is the start of 18th season for the Matrics of 2010. The honour has been bestowed upon us by the rest of the January babies to kick off the partying spirit for the year and we shall be hosting a bit of a pre-match party for all you lovely ladies and gentlemen. 

The party is going to be at my (Justin) house and we pretty much all gonna get krunk before we board ship towards the infamous Claremont. I know the majority of you aren't 18 so you have ample time to throw together a fake ID or two, for all the females I doubt you'll get bounced. Ecerybody must please organise their own transport to Claremont.

There will be a large quantity of alcohol there but please B.Y.O.BOOZE as well and bring as much as you like because, come now, It's an effing 18th! 
"Gifts are..look, I would say unnecessary but follow your heart" - Barney Stinson

There will be a list for the guys but Inbox me or one of the admins if we forgot anybody. All you wonderful ladies are welcome.


"When we drink, we get drunk. When we get drunk, we fall asleep. When we fall asleep, we commit no sin. When we commit no sin, we go to heaven. Sssoooo, lets all get drunk, and go to heaven."
originalevent.name: JUSTIN & GARY'S BIG 18

originalevent.description:
NOTE – The Franschhoek Mountains in July can be covered in snow. The rivers are scenic yet cold. These runs are a wilderness adventure, for which you need to be prepared – you have been warned!

Online Entries Close: Tuesday 7 July 2015 9am!!! Late entries can be done at registration.

This festival of adventure trail running sold out last year, numbers are limited. You are assured of a wild time, wet feet and rewarding OBS, served by French Maids and Men at the end. The Bastille Festival in the Main Street is a vibrant mix of good food and wine, to celebrate with, after your run. If staying over (highly recommended), book accommodation now – chat to Franschhoek Tourism ASAP

50km - 06:30
35km - 07:00
25km - from 08:00 (10min Batch Starts)
15km - from 09:00 (10min Batch Starts)

Venue open from 6:00am on race day!

The start finish zone is located at the ‘Old Bells Lodge’ on the edge of the Berg River dam, (33’56’12.83’S, 19′ 4’27.14’E). Coming from Paarl side, head through Franschhoek on the main road (R45) until you hit the T-Junction at the Franschhoek Monument. Turn right and then right again onto the Robertsvlei road. Carry on for 5km and marshals will direct you to the parking.
Route info:

15km (R225): Not such a beginner trail run, mostly on forest tracks and gravel roads, with some single-track and short technical (loose rocks, bushy) section. Moderate inclines. Your feet will get wet at river crossings. All rocks are slippery!

25km (R325): Not for beginners. Open gravel road start with a hill to spread the field, takes you to a vertical firebreak climb, and on to a gnarly and exposed single track – with amazing views. This is a ‘no passing’ zone, as a tumble will go on for a while. Over the neck and on to forest tracks and wooded river-side single-track. That’s halfway! This is not a sprint, but an adventure. Compulsory kit.

35km (R425): For the hard-core mountain goats. Follows the same route as the 24km, then veers off to circumnavigate the Berg river dam.

50km (R525): Two extra mountain summits and two beautiful valleys. Take lots of food (expected time 5-8 hours)
Compulsory Equipment for all:

Compulsory Equipment for 25km, 35km, 50km categories.

1) Rain Jacket (waterproof, not just wind breaker, which you may have as well);
2) Sensible Clothing for the conditions, eg. compulsory thermal base layer;
3) Charged cell phone in waterproof bag eg. Ziplock (organizers - for emergencies only - 072 924 2371);
4) Food – sarmie, fruit, energy bars - for 4 to 10 hours!
5) Water – hydration pack, with bladder. You will be crossing several fresh water rivers.
6) Space Blanket & Whistle
7) Headlamp/Torch and Race Map - provided

Compulsory Equipment for 15km

1) Rain Jacket (waterproof, not just wind breaker, which you may have as well);
2) Sensible Clothing for the conditions;
3) Water – hydration pack, with bladder. You will be crossing several fresh water rivers.

Recommended Equipment:
Beanie, Buff, Gloves. Ladies, add a couple of layers. Toes, fingers freeze. Lips go blue.

Trail Gear available in Salomon Concept Store. Sale starts 7th July
originalevent.name: Salomon Bastille Day Trail Run

originalevent.description:
Join us this April (2015) for our 3rd annual Red My Lips campaign!!! ♥

Red My Lips is an international nonprofit organization that uses red lipstick as a weapon and a tool to raise awareness about sexual violence, combat rape myths and victim-blaming, and demonstrate solidarity and support for ALL survivors. Our supporters, which we call 'Warriors,' wear red lipstick all throughout April (Sexual Assault Awareness Month) to raise awareness and funds. This is not about VANITY. It's about VISIBILITY. (Kind of like Movember...minus the brilliantly creepy 'staches.) Spread the word that RAPISTS are responsible for RAPE...not drinking, short skirts, or makeup.

Sexual violence is NOT a WOMEN'S ISSUE. It is a HUMAN ISSUE. It affects us ALL.

Don't want to wear lipstick? You can still participate! 

Since our symbol is red lips, we encourage supporters to incorporate red lips is some (visible) way. Here are some of our favorite alternatives:

-- Ask a loved one to give you a red lipstick kiss and leave it on your face each day. (Ask ONE time and respect their answer. This is a great opportunity to practice consent!)
-- Wear a RML temporary tattoo (if you have one)
-- Paint one nail red or (better yet!) paint red lips on your nails!
-- Wear clothes or accessories that have red lips or lip prints on them.
-- Print a large picture of red lips and put it on the back window of your car with the words "Red My Lips" and the website.
-- Wear red lipstick for a photo and set it as your profile pic, making sure to link to the cause.
-- Leave a lipstick print on your dog and take them for a walk. :)

Have more ideas? Feel free to share!
____________________________________

To learn more about our organization and get involved, please check out our website: www.redmylips.org and follow our main page, by clicking 'Like' here --> Red My Lips. You can also find us on Instagram and Twitter @redmylipsorg. And don't forget to tag us in your RML pics and use the hashtag: #redmylips!

Donate --> www.classy.org/checkout/donation?eid=44752
Fundraise --> www.classy.org/redmylips2015

*Logo Usage: Please note that no individual, organization, or company may use our logo for commercial purposes, particularly on merchandise or products they plan to sell without our written permission.
originalevent.name: Red My Lips 2015

originalevent.description:
Fast, flat and perfect fine tuning 
Sondela Nature Reserve, only 45 minutes’ drive on the N1 north of Pretoria, is where the inaugural Sondela SuperClassic road race takes place on October 27.

Participants can choose between two distances on a flat and fast course, offering a perfect last training ride two weeks prior to the Momentum 94.7 Cycle Challenge.

The long ride covers 104 km but there is also a 40km option. The roads are quiet and the surface good, presenting an excellent opportunity to riders who are looking for a good morale booster before the Cycle Challenge. 

For further info and to enter, visit: www.asgevents.co.za 

Sondela has been a popular Bushveld getaway for many years, maintaining a high occupancy rate. The resort excels in playing host to mass-participation cycling events, as evidenced by the Sondela Mountain Bike Challenge, which attracted 1 500 riders in winter this year.

The resort’s management are putting everything in place for a wonderful family weekend with lots of entertainment for children, a massive beer tent and all sorts of delicious eats and drinks.
A secure bike park is available. Participants will receive wrist tags at registration, which will ensure the safekeeping of bikes while the owners enjoy the festivities over the weekend.

The event starts at the entrance to Sondela, which is off the main slipway into Bela-Bela. Ample parking is cordoned off from the entrance back towards the N1. More than 25 ushers will be on duty to help drivers park their vehicles. The ushers will look after the vehicles all day.

Route description 
There are only two right turns on the long ride and one on the short distance. All other turns are left-turns.

The 104km route goes out towards Settlers on the R516, then through Settlers before turning right back on the R516. Riders carry on along this road until they turn left at Crecy Road. The smooth road surface continues to the T-junction where the route takes a left turn again on to the R33. This section does have potholes, which have been filled, but riders should look out for uneven sections.

Just after the 70km mark another left turn awaits before the route joins up with the R516 left and right back towards Sondela.

The short ride goes out to Settlers and immediately turns left and back on the R516 towards Sondela.
There is one water point on the short ride (at the R516 joining) and three on the long ride.
As at all ASG events, medical specialists MMC will be on hand to look after any medical requirements and emergencies. Road Rangers bike marshals will also be on duty to ensure safe passage for cyclists. Suzuki Montana will supply lead vehicles to lend assistance.

Date: 27 October 2012
Where: Sondela Nature Reserve, 45 minutes from Pretoria on the N1
Distances and entry fees: 104 km (R200) and 40 km (R120-00) 
Start time: 06:00 
Prize giving: 11:00
Timing: RaceTec
On-line entries and further information: www.asgevents.co.za
For further info on Sondela and for directions go to www.sondela.com
For bookings, email info@sondela.com
For race enquiries email eventsupport@asgworld.co.za or phone 076 621 1807

Mountain-bike fun ride
Cyclists who fancy taking part in a double header over the weekend can enter the Sondela MTB fun ride the day after the road race.
Date:  28 October
Time: 08:00
Distance: 25 km
Course: flat, jeep track and single track
Entry fee: R120
originalevent.name: Sondela SuperClassic presented by ASG

originalevent.description:
נתי לוי (43) שחרר את אלבומו ה-13 "נוסע" ,לאחר עבודה מאומצת של 4 שנים ויעלה אי"ה על בימת הרידיניג 3 במופע בכורה מתוך סבב הופעות רחב שמתוכנן הקיץ.


לוי, מהאומנים והיוצרים המוערכים בזמר הים תיכוני עם קרירה עשירה של 25 שנה מחזיר אותנו אל הניגונים וצלילי המקור בזמר הים תיכוני ומוכיח שניתן לחבר בהצלחה בין שורשי המוסיקה המזרחית לבין הצלילים המודרניים וליצור אלבום מניפה המהווה מסע מוסיקלי .


האלבום החדש "נוסע" מהווה מסע מוסיקלי ייחודי המציג טעם של פעם בנגיעות עכשוויות וכולל 19 רצועות הנעות על סקאלת החיים ,יצירות שמחה סוחפות לצד בלאדות מרגשות שעל רובם חתום לוי עצמו .באלבום ,שלדבריו נוצר מתוך מחשבה עמוקה ומתוך רצון שלא להיסחף למנגינת הזמן ולהישאר נאמן לשורשיו . מוכיח לוי את יכולותיו לא רק בבלדות השקטות אלא גם במקצב מזרחי –מודרני. לצד שיריו שלו ,מעניק לוי מקום של כבוד לאבני דרך במוסיקה הישראלית ומצדיע בשני חידושי מחווה מרגשים לגדולי היוצרים מושא הערצתו, אהוד מנור (ללכת שבי אחרייך) ועוזי חיטמן (רציתי שתדע).


לצד יוצרי ענק אלו ,מעניק לוי במה גם לאומנים חדשים בשני שיתופי פעולה,הראשון עם עזרי קרואני (לך תמיד) בניחוח מזרחי רוקיסטי ,השני בדואט עם יקיר ונה (ממעון שמייך) שיר תפילה בשילוב מילים מהמקורות שנעטף במוסיקת עולם שמימית .


בשנת 1987, בגיל 19 בלבד , עם אלבומו הראשון "שלום נערתי" שאותו הפיק ציון שרעבי,שכלל להיטים רבים הפך נתי לוי לאחד השמות החמים ביותר במוזיקה המזרחית עם להיטים כמו: "סוכר", "נטלי", "אישה", "פרא אדם" ואחרים. מאז הוציא נתי מספר רב של אלבומים הכוללים את הלהיטים "אנא אלי" ,"למענך" ועוד .בנוסף זכה להצלחה רבה בשיתוף פעולה פורה עם פיני חדד בזכות להיטים רבים כמו: "ילדה רעה", "צמא לאהבה","הכוכבת" ,"אוהב אבל מציאותי" ועוד.
בשנים האחרונות אף כתב לאומנים רבים בניהם: שלומי שבת (מתוקה שלי) ,ליאור נרקיס (עד סוף ימיי) ,רובי לוי (מת לחבק אותך) ועוד.


במופע מציג נתי לוי להיטים ישנים לצד חדשים, יארח אומנים שעימם שיתף פעולה במהלך הקריירה שלו.... 

קלידים - גדי בן מנחם
גיטרה בס - אלי בקל

פסנתר וניהול מוסיקלי - נדב ביטון

בשנת 1970, זכה גדסי במקום הראשון בתחרות "זמר עיר הנוער" 
ובשנת 1972 התפרסם עם הלהיט הגדול "נפרדנו כך" 
ומשם החל לסלול את דרכו עם הלהיטים :
"שרונה", "מנגן ושר", "חלפו ימי", "נערה מספרד", "הגברים בוכים בלילה", "לוליטה", "נכון להיום", "אישה בונה אישה הורסת"  ועוד רבים וטובים…. 

במופע המוצג גדסי מבצע  שירים שהולחו על ידו ובוצעו ע"י זוהר ארגוב ז"ל ומרגש את הקהל בכל פעם מחדש בייחודיות שלו.

נוגע בכל הסגנונות כמו בלוז, רוק, ים תיכוני וכל השאר. בימים אלה יוצא גדסי למסע הופעות לרגל 40 שנות זמר שבהם יארח אומנים מן השורה.

originalevent.description:
A madcap stage adaptation of the famed 1935 Alfred Hitchcock film (and John Buchan novel) of the same title, 39 Steps trails unsuspecting Englishman Richard Hannay (Lance Laubscher)as he is inadvertently drawn into an elaborate plot by a dark and beautiful female spy. (Fiona Tanner).

When the same woman is mysteriously murdered in Hannay’s apartment, he must flee the country in an attempt to save his own life from her diabolical pursuers. 

On the run from both the pursuing authorities and a team of assassins sent to kill him before he discovers the meaning of the puzzling “39 Steps,” Hannay is met by an outrageous cast of characters, from suspicious Scotsmen to an evil professor to an innocent female companion (with a temper). A whirlwind adventure, 39 Steps pays homage to Hitchcock and the classic film mysteries with an unapologetic, tongue-in-cheek flair that has won over audiences on Broadway, London and around the world.
originalevent.name: The 39 Steps

originalevent.description:
Back to Gilqua!

It's that time of the year again where we all gather to be reunited in the Gilqua spirit! 

Please join us for 24th Gilqua's closing campfire. The event is open to all fellow scouts, family and friends - so invite them all! You do not have to have previously attended a PLTU in order to come to the campfire. It is open to all!

You are welcome to arrive at Hawequas from 16:30 onwards. There shall be a bring and braai which will start at 17:00. We shall provide the braai facilities so please just bring your own meat. The campfire will start at 19:30 and will be finished by 21:00.

You may come in either casual wear or uniform depending on your preference. We encourage you to wear a purple scout shirt if you have one, and if you have previously been on PLTU, why not wear your scarf too?
Please bring a warm jacket and a good scouting spirit!

Please pass this invite around to your friends, family and fellow scouts. It would be fantastic to see some Gilqua Alumni returning to the campfire again!

Let's make this campfire the biggest and greatest one to date! We look forward to seeing you there!
originalevent.name: 24th Gilqua PLTU Closing Campfire

originalevent.description:
All aboard for the South African premiere of James Lantz’ s thought provoking play “ The Bus” which will be staged in Cape Town at the Milnerton Playhouse from July 20 to 28.

It is a story that is both touching and suspenseful, exploring sexual awakenings against the background of powerful church influences. Jordan and Ian are the main characters,  two boys who regularly rendezvous in a parked bus that belongs to the most powerful church in town, Golden Rule. Late at night, they meet to explore sexual feelings that are at once awkward, humorous, and kept from the light of day. When their secret meeting place is in danger of being discovered, the boys find themselves caught in a conﬂict between Golden Rule and a gas station owned by Ian’s father — and the clash proves explosive. It is a touching tale that swirls with suspense.
.
The play was first performed off Off-Broadway in New York City in 2011 and received rave reviews:

“The Bus is theater magic! It’s beautiful in every way theater should be! … The best show I’ve seen in a long, long time!”  Weston Clay, Theatre Is Easy, NYC

“The Bus packs a wallop! … By the end of this production, some in the audience were teary-eyed and most were touched because this little play is not really so little at all.” Elizabeth Ahlfors, Curtain Up, NYC

The subject matter is such that it will appeal to a diverse audience as it did in the US. Making his directorial debut is Wayne Hendricks who has gathered together a committed and enthusiastic cast. 

While the majority of the cast are making their acting debut the Milnerton Players are known for their professional productions and “The Bus” is breaking new ground for this well established society.

"The Bus" stars Timothy Mayers, Darin Graham, Johann van der Merwe, Robynn Bensch, Coleen Tapson and Barry Altwig.

Please note that "The Bus" does contain strong language and deals with mature themes.

Please visit "The Bus" site www.thebusplay.co.za for updates on the play, read our blog and to get more information on this awesome play.

Booking can be done from 22 June online at www.milnertonplayers.com via email to bookings@milnertonplayers.com or via phone at 082 267 1061
originalevent.name: The Bus

The competition commences with a 72-hour Qualification Round on January 20, 2012 at 4:00 PM PT (that's January 21, 2012 at 12:00 AM UTC; see countdown at http://fb.me/1glVt0CnM) and ends on January 23, 2012 at 4:00 PM PT (that's January 24, 2012 at 12:00 AM UTC). All registered competitors will be presented with three problems. Each problem will consist of one input file. Competitors can log in to the competition website and attempt to solve the 3 problems anytime during the 72-hour period of the Qualification Round. Every competitor who correctly solves at least 1 problem will advance to Online Round 1.

Remember, once you click the link to download the input file you have six minutes to upload your program's output file. If you fail to upload it within 6 minutes you will not get credit for the problem.

As most of you know, next week Monday I leave CPT for what is commonly known as the place where white trash go to die - aka Brandfort. 

In order to celebrate this not so very glorious change in my life and get all my goodbyes out of the way, I have decided to give you all a minor taste of Brandfort on Saturday the 25th. 

Therefore at 15:00 we will assemble with our meat, our drink, and make a fire. And then, like they do almost daily in Free State we will burn the meat while consuming the drink and hopefully not set anyone on fire. 

Then afterwards we will venture into Tableview and go bar hopping OR if perhaps GAT party. I will confirm this later. 

Hope to see you there. Please RSVP before Friday.
originalevent.name: A Taste of Brandfort - The Final Hoorah.

Traffic information for the day:
•	Access to Val De Vie on the day  will be easiest from the N1 side of the R301 as there are roadworks from the Franschoek end
•	We encourage our listeners to use the N1 instead
•	Take exit 59 off the N1 which is just across the Berg River ( The roads name is Jan Van Riebeeck)
•	We will have a traffic official at this intersection to make sure we have a free flow of traffic off the highway
•	When travelling along Jan van Riebeeck towards the venue,  we will have traffic patrols on site to channel vehicles along this route
•	Clear signage will indicate a right only lane for KDAY so we ask commuters to obey directional and event signage
•	We discourage any stopping along shoulders of the road and our traffic patrols will make sure this does not happen
•	Kday does not have ONE start time and this will ease the flow of traffic over a 3 hour period between 9am and 12noon.
•	Parking for the event is all onsite at Val De Vie and no vehicles will be allowed to park on public roads. 
•	A secure and clearly marked parking plan is in place for the entire duration of the concert
•	This includes traffic pointsmen, parking pointsmen and exit officials when leaving the estate.
•	Our aim is to create the best consumer experience for Kday 2011 and we can only do this with your help.

originalevent.description:
So, Ladies and Gentlemen and those in between, it is once again that time of the year to celebrate my birthday. 
Since I've been pretty much off the radar for a while now, I thought it best to throw a little gathering in order to celebrate with those I haven't seen as well as with those I have. 

This isn't going to be glamorous or extravagant (at least I don't think so), but since it is the start of the long weekend, i will be celebrating over about 4 days, so this will be the beginning. Therefore, I ask that as with all beginnings, I would like everyone to be there to celebrate the dawning of my day of birth with me. 

Alas, I have yet to perfect the growing of money on the little tree next to my bed, however, I shall try to organise something. Though no promises will be made as of yet. However, there is a wide range of cocktails and wines (feel free to bring your own wine) available at good prices (hence, not ridiculously expensive) and for those who don't drink, there are other options for you as well, so don't feel left out. 

We might make our way to other places after this, most of you know which ones, but that will be for those that want to continue partying and for those who don't, well, there will more another four days to make up for it :)

If you want to bring people that I don't know or do know but don't have on here... just put it down on the wall to let me know. The more the merrier.

So...
Will YOU party with me?
originalevent.name: 20 Years Young

originalevent.description:
I love outdoor trance parties and love even more having my friends with me. So sign up, bring your tents and come and join our tent group!

~The Story of Earthdance~
Every year Earthdance joins like-minded people across the planet at over 300 Earthdance events in a joyous celebration of non-stop music, dance and peace. Earthdance strives to raise awareness of issues affecting society today while raising money for local charities too. At 1am on Sunday morning all Earthdance events link via the “Prayer for Peace” meditation, a song that is played at all events at exactly the same time, connecting all participants at every Earthdance.
 
Over the centuries, Scientists and mystics have honored water’s sacred and restorative properties. It is increasingly evident that this precious resource is now critically endangered. To raise awareness about the importance of water, we have chosen "The Sacredness of Water" as our international Earthdance theme for 2007. Take a look at the Earthdance international website for more info about this and look out for info at the event.
 
 
Earthdance 2007 returns with multiple stages blasting Psy-Trance, Electronica, Breaks, Electro-Rock, Dub, Minimal, Tech-House, Techno, Rock, Folk, Indie, Balkan and other worldly beats.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.earthdance.org.za/capetown/earthdance_ct.html
For more details.....

The tickets prices are R145-00 pre-sold and  R170.00 at the gate!
originalevent.name: Earthdance Cape Town - Paul
